{"step_by_step_thinking": "Master of Public Health (MPH) programs are designed to equip students with the knowledge and skills necessary to contribute to the strengthening of health systems. This includes understanding the social, economic, and environmental determinants of health, as well as the policies and practices that can improve health outcomes. In low- and middle-income countries, where health systems may be weaker and resources more limited, the impact of MPH programs can be particularly significant. By training local health professionals in public health principles and practices, these programs can help to build capacity, improve health services, and ultimately strengthen the health system.", "answer_choice": "A"}
